statement.tex: \\ \text{Which of the following shows the correct }\log f(x)?

reason.tex: \text{If }a = x\cdot y\cdot z,\text{ then }\log a = \log x + \log y + \log z.\\ \text{This is a standard result. Review if you got it wrong.}

options.tex: \begin{align} \log f(x) &= \log (\cos x) + \log (\cos 2x) \\ &+ \log (\cos 3x) \\ \implies\dfrac{1}{f(x)}\dfrac{d}{dx}f(x) &= \dfrac{d}{dx}\log(\cos x) + \dfrac{d}{dx}\log(\cos 2x) \\ &+ \dfrac{d}{dx}\log(\cos 3x) \\ &= -\left(\tan x + 2\tan 2x + 3\tan 3x\right) \\ \implies \dfrac{d}{dx}f(x) &= -(\cos x\cdot\cos 2\cdot\cos 3x)\\ &\times\left[\tan x+\tan 2x + \tan 3x\right] \end{align}

reason.tex: \text{Use Step 1 to write }\log f(x)\text{ and Step 2}\\ \text{to write }\frac{d}{dx}\log (\cos Nx). \text{That's it.}
